Description: Foot and tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stemless cup; interior: glazed streaky black (fired red) save for tondo, with added red band at tondo perimeter; black-figure decoration consisting of running bearded warrior, to left, looking back, spear raised (greave on right leg; shield in left hand; sheathed sword on baldric; red on hair, beard and shield); in field, drips of glaze misfired red; outside and foot glazed save for stand-ring; dot, circle and band underneath foot.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0670) (Phase 1)
